description.narrative:
1) Project Impact Assessment: i) Stakeholder effect - Change in accessibility of finance for SMEs. The proposed project is expected to increase access to finance for SMEs in Kenya through both IFC's investment and advisory services to the Bank on SME lending. ii) Stakeholder effect - Change in accessibility, affordability and quality of climate finance. Part of IFC's investment will be deployed to support EBK's growing sustainable energy finance operations in Kenya. IFC's advisory services providing targeted support to EBK on green finance will help the Bank build a strong green business strategy and develop capacity to offer green financing solutions targeting the Bank's core clients in Kenya.
2) Market Impact Assessment: i) Sustainability - The proposed project is expected to promote greater sustainability by demonstrating the commercial viability of sustainable energy finance in Kenya. Capacity building through IFC advisory will bring international expertise to the market and help identify climate-smart investment opportunities and quantify the GHG avoidance. ii) Competitiveness - The project is expected to have a catalytic effect on SME finance and sustainable energy finance in Kenya and attract more banks into these segments.

The project consists of an up to US$100 million subordinated loan to Equity Bank (Kenya) Limited (EBK or the Bank) to strengthen the Banks regulatory capital and support its lending program to the underserved micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) segment in Kenya. The project also aims at supporting the Banks growing sustainable energy finance operations.
